item.title: How to Get EXPcalibur Sword in Dying Light The Beast (All Stone Sigil Locations)
item.description:
Dying Light: The Beast has several powerful legendary weapons hidden away in locations that only the most keen-eyed players will find. The legendary long-sword Excalibur (EXPcalibur II) is one of these weapons that has made an appearance in the previous entries and returns in all its glory in the sequel. However, pulling the EXPcalibur from the stone isn't a simple process, as you'll need to find all 8 stone sigils to place near the weapon to get it.

Where to Find All Stone Sigils for EXPcalibur in Dying Light: The Beast (Locations)

Before players make their way to get Excalibur (EXPcalibur II) from the stone, they'll need to locate eight stone sigils scattered around the map in Dying Light: The Beast . While most of the stone sigils can be acquired without progressing the story much, some locations are only accessible after completing a specific story mission. Here's where to find all of them.

Stone Sigil The Void Location

The first stone sigil can be found southeast of the Monastery , near the waterfalls in Dying Light: The Beast . Climb up to the high platform, and you'll spot a small opening leading into a cave behind the waterfall.

Head inside the cave, and you'll need to fight a few enemies before coming across some loot and a purple-rarity baseball bat at the end. Look to the left, and you'll spot a small pond inside the cave , which you can dive into to get the Void stone sigil from a deer's skull (antlers).

Stone Sigil The Moon Location

The next stone sigil is quite nearby to the previous location, just exit the cave and head up to the path on the right. Reach the location marked on the map above to come across a small crack that Kyle can squeeze through .

Heading through the crack, you'll come across a hidden camp area with yellow-leaf trees and a tent. Just as you enter this area, look to the immediate left, and you'll spot a wide stone with The Moon stone sigil placed on it.

Stone Sigil Witch's Mark Location

The next stone sigil's location is also nearby, but you'll need to go around the mountain and follow the river into the pass east of the previous location . After traversing the path for a while, you'll spot an abandoned cabin at the end of the trail.

There will be alot of zombies in the area that you can either eliminate or make a run for the cabin. Just as you enter the cabin, you'll be able to grab the Witch's Mark stone sigil from the wall to the right .

Stone Sigil Sacrifice Location

Head further east from the previous location, and you'll arrive at a location with stone slabs displayed in the open . You'll spot a small enclosed area to the left of the area that you can enter.

Once inside the area, turn around, and you'll find the Sacrifice stone sigil on the middle wall (stone slab).

Stone Sigil Blood Location

The next area you'll need to reach is St. Valentine Asylum, specifically its courtyard. Head to the exact location shown above to spot a fountain in the middle of the courtyard that will have the Blood stone sigil stuck to it.

Stone Sigil Curse Location

For the next stone sigil, you'll need to head further north from the asylum, until you come across the Memorial Hill of Heroes . While facing the memorial when coming from the asylum, make a run for the treeline to the right (location marked on the image above).

As you run further into the woods, you'll eventually come out into a small area with tree roots in the middle, and a skeleton lying next to it. You can grab the Curse stone sigil from the skeleton's mouth .

Stone Sigil Death Location

The next location you'll need to visit to find the stone sigil is the church inside the Old Town. This location will only be accessible after players complete the third main mission of Dying Light: The Beast called " The Beast Within ."

If you've completed the mission, simply head to the church's entrance and go inside the small opening to the immediate right. This will lead to the crypt of the church, where you'll be able to grab the Death stone sigil from the angel's statue to the right .

Stone Sigil Shadow Location

The final sigil can be found in the Cave of Exiles, which only unlocks after players complete the eighth main story mission of the game called "Some Like It Dark."

If you've got the cave unlocked, simply head inside, and you'll find the Shadow stone sigil near the entrance, beside some cushions and candles.

How to Get Excalibur (EXPcalibur II) in Dying Light: The Beast

Now that you have all eight stone sigils in Dying Light: The Beast , it's time to reach the EXPcalibur location and pull the sword out of the stone. The Excalibur (EXPcalibur II) is located northeast of the Monastery, atop a mount . Simply follow the location marked on the map above to reach the area.

After making it to the area, you'll come across a series of outcroppings with vines over them. Use the first series of vines to get to a higher ledge of the outcrop.

Move around the mount to find a climbable path to the side. Use the markers on the image above to make your way to the top of the outcrop.

Once you're at the top of the outcrop, you'll spot a ritualistic sight with the EXPcalibur sticking out of the stone in the middle. Simply place all eight sigils at the corners of the star-shaped sticks to spawn an enemy.

Once the enemy is taken care of, you'll be able to interact with the sword. So, start pulling the sword, which will take significantly more time than picking up another weapon (similar to previous entries). Once the white circle around the interaction prompt completes, you'll get the legendary long-sword Excalibur (EXPcalibur) in Dying Light: The Beast .

9.5 /10
8 /10

Dying Light: The Beast

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games That Punish You for Being Nice, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Games like Burnout Paradise and Gothic reward aggression over kindness, making it essential for players to embrace the chaotic nature of gameplay.
  • In titles like Bully and Cyberpunk 2077, being nice can put players at a disadvantage, requiring them to make pragmatic decisions instead.
  • Red Dead Redemption 2 and The Witcher 3 emphasize that being too nice can lead to exploitation, urging players to find a balance between morality and self-preservation.

Most games don't exactly encourage players to be nice. Sure, some combat-heavy games feature non-lethal approaches, but it's hard to justify someone being nice when they're still beating enemies to a pulp and probably breaking a ton of bones in the process.

In games where chaos is so much fun, playing it safe for the sake of being nice might work against a player's enjoyment. They should accept that breaking the rules and being a bad guy is fun in these games since it's a part of a power fantasy where players can flex their skills and cause untold carnage and mayhem.

8 Burnout Paradise

There's No Point in Being Nice When Being Aggressive Against Racers is Encouraged

Burnout Paradise
Racing
Systems
Released
January 22, 2008
ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Criterion Games

Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

The Burnout games are all about dirty racing and taking down other racers to gain a higher score. So, it's easy to see why trying to be nice while engaging in illegal street races full of mayhem and destruction isn't the best way to go about things.

Instead, players should land the most creative takedowns and ensure that they remain in the lead by any means necessary. The amazing destruction physics and the scintillating arcade racing in Burnout Paradise mean that players won't feel too bad about smashing other racers to a pulp anytime soon.

7 Gothic

The Game is Already Hard Enough as is Without the Protagonist Being Exploited for Being Too Nice

Gothic
10 /10
Released
November 23, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Piranha Bytes
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
3 Images
Powered by

Gothic is a game that will chew up and spit out any player who thinks that being honorable is the way to go. The weakest monsters in the game can overpower and kill players at low levels, forcing them to use sneaky, underhanded tactics to attain victory even after getting some moves under their belt.

In the camps, players might have to play it nice a few times, but doing it over and over again is not the best course of action to take. Instead, players must get strong and bully the bullies; otherwise, they'll become an easy and soft target to get some ore from over and over again.

6 Bully

A Rockstar Game Where Being Nice is What Causes Jimmy to Fall Down the Social Ladder

Bully
9.2 /10
Released
October 17, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Vancouver
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS2, PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Wii, Mobile
Powered by

The name Bully should make it clear that this game is not about being a nice, rule-following student. Jimmy is the nicest he can be with Gary, only to be double-crossed as he's utterly humiliated by a person he considered to be his friend.

What follows is a tale of revenge as Jimmy strongarms the cliques of Bullworth Academy to support him, allowing him to get a shot at taking Gary down for humiliating him. Throughout this adventure, players are encouraged to skip school, get into fistfights, and engage in all manner of actions that would lead to anyone being labeled as a truant.

5 Grand Theft Auto 5

It's Not Fun to Try to Be a Good Guy in a Game About Crime and Violence

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
151
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar North
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
5 Images
Powered by

No Grand Theft Auto game rewards kindness and being nice. The fifth mainline entry is no exception, with the trio of Franklin, Trevor, and Michael committing numerous crimes in a bid to become richer and more powerful than ever.

Grand Theft Auto 5 is at its very best when it shows terrible people being antagonistic towards each other. Trevor may be the most beloved character in the series, but that stems from the fact that he's rude to everyone and everything around him, with his wacky persona making him one of the best GTA protagonists of all time.

4 Cyberpunk 2077

Night City is Vicious and Will Eat V Up if They're Too Nice

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
119
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Publisher(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
6 Images
Powered by

V wants to become a legend in Night City, but this goal can't be achieved by being a goody-two-shoes. Instead, they must take part in numerous crimes and take actions that are pragmatic, even if they may not necessarily be nice.

It doesn't help that the lines between good and evil are blurred in most of the game's impactful stories. What may seem like a "nice" act for some people isn't how other people may perceive the same decision, highlighting just how brilliant and multifaceted the stories in Cyberpunk 2077 are.

3 Red Dead Redemption 2

Even With High Honor, Players Will Hate Abiding By the Law and Being a Good Person for Too Long

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
172
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

While playing with High Honor is certainly the best way to experience Arthur Morgan's story, that doesn't mean he should be a patron of justice at all times. In fact, being too nice will lead to Arthur being taken advantage of, with the nightmarish encounter at the Aberdeen Pig Farm being a glaring example.

So, while it's completely fine to raise Arthur's Honor in the game, there's a limit to how nice players should be in the game. Robberies and going against the law are a huge part of what makes this game so much fun, and players will be missing out on some of Red Dead Redemption 2 's best moments of emergent gameplay if they try to be nice all the time.

2 Disco Elysium

Harry Will Be Taken Advantage of if He's Too Nice and Forthcoming

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
ZA/UM
Publisher(s)
ZA/UM
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The incredible worldbuilding of Disco Elysium ensures that fans will love what this story-driven CRPG brings to the table. Harry Du Bois is an excellent character who will leave a lasting impression on players courtesy of his own unraveling sanity.

While it's possible to be a nice guy in this game, players will find themselves in situations where they must humor racists and plead with annoying characters to get the thing they want. Some players may not like being so subservient to characters who are clearly taking advantage of Harry, which is why being a bad cop is useful to make substantial progress in the investigation from time to time.

1 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Can't Be Too Nice in a Savage World Full of Opportunists

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Publisher(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The incredible writing of The Witcher 3 ensures that its writing never puts players in a black-or-white situation. Rather, the morals of the story are up to the player's interpretation, and there's nothing to be gained from being too nice to people.

Geralt is a witcher in a dark fantasy world that looks down on his kind, and players must ensure that some opportunists don't end up walking all over him. The rage players feel after being taken advantage of by characters like Keira and Dijkstra is something they can avoid by being smart instead of being a nice yes man who solves all of their problems without batting an eye.

item.title: Fortnite Leak Hints at New Star Wars Event
item.description:
Recent leaks from Fortnite are hinting at a brand-new Star Wars event set to run before the end of Chapter 6 Season 4, teasing a special live event. Fortnite 's litany of crossovers throughout the game's history have often made sweeping changes to everything from the game's weapons to the in-game map of the battle royale. Previous seasons have featured the addition of weapons based on series like Dragon Ball Z , Futurama , and Deadpool , alongside map changes like an in-game tribute to JUICE WRLD. Now, a brand-new event based on a beloved sci-fi franchise may be in the works.

Fortnite has a long history of collaborations with the iconic Star Wars franchise, given its status as one of the most beloved properties in science fiction. Fortnite has featured more than thirty different Star Wars skins throughout the game's lifetime, both celebrating iconic characters like Darth Vader and Chewbacca and introducing new cast members like Rey and Kylo Ren. Fortnite has even offered in-game lightsabers for players to find within the battle royale as a special melee weapon for its Star Wars collabs. A new rumor now suggests that Star Wars may be coming back to Fortnite once again.

A recent report from prominent Fortnite leaker Loolo is hinting at the upcoming launch of another major Star Wars event. According to the post, Epic Games is currently working on a "new live event" for Fortnite based on Star Wars , expected to be added to the game during Chapter 6 Season 4. The leak suggests that the event may arrive with Fortnite 's 37.50 update, with the event potentially being tied to new Star Wars content coming to the UEFN. Loolo does not clarify a specific release date for the event, though he does suggest that it will not be the end-of-season event.

Fortnite May Be Getting a New Star Wars Event

Fortnite 's rumored new Star Wars event could have plenty to work with, given Epic Games' previous reveals for the franchise. Epic Games first teased the new collaboration earlier this year, confirming that Fortnite would add Star Wars -themed content to the UEFN as part of its June "State of Unreal" broadcast. The developer also potentially gave fans a taste of what could be possible within the UEFN Star Wars update, with a fully AI-voiced Darth Vader being added to Fortnite for a limited time.

While fans await Fortnite and Star Wars ' next big crossover, the battle royale is giving its players plenty to be excited about with its newest updates. Power Rangers has served as the biggest spotlight crossover throughout the ongoing season, with both individual Ranger skins and an in-game Megazord added to Fortnite . Next month's "Fortnitemares" event has also seen some exciting rumors, with hints about Scooby-Doo and Jason Voorhees skins among others. Fortnite fans should have lots to look forward to from the shooter throughout the rest of the year.

294
8.9 /10

Fortnite

item.title: Fortnite Adds Unexpected New Crossover with Classic Anime Series
item.description:
Fortnite is rolling out a surprising new crossover with a classic anime series, adding some new Kicks to the game based on Yu-Gi-Oh . The massively popular battle royale has featured no shortage of crossover content based on a wide variety of pop culture franchises, ranging from TV shows and movies to beloved musicians. Recent crossovers have brought everything from Power Rangers and Beavis & Butthead to popular figures like Kai Cenat and John Cena to Fortnite among others. Now, Epic Games has introduced an unexpected new collaboration to the game.

Anime has been one of the most popular sources for many of Fortnite 's crossovers, including a plethora of fan-favorite animated series from Japan. Fortnite 's anime collabs have featured some of the most beloved series of all-time, with fan-favorites like Dragon Ball Z , Naruto , and My Hero Academia being introduced as skins. The battle royale has even often added special weapons to the game for its anime crossovers, allowing fans to flex iconic attacks like Goku's "Kamehameha" and "Deku's Smash." Fortnite 's most recent collaboration is now introducing some surprise Yu-Gi-Oh content.

A recent update to Fortnite 's in-game shop officially saw the introduction of a brand-new Yu-Gi-Oh cosmetic for players to pick up. The crossover content comes in the form of a new Kicks cosmetic, with the "Nike Air Max 95 Yu-Gi-Oh! Jounichi" shoes modeled after the appearance of supporting character Joey Wheeler's shoes. The Kicks also feature another subtle nod to its inspiration, with the Yu-Gi-Oh! logo emblazoned into the soles of the shoes. Fans can pick up the Yu-Gi-Oh -themed Kicks for a limited time, available for 1,000 V-Bucks until September 26 at 8:00 P.M. local time.

Fortnite Adds Unexpected Yu-Gi-Oh Crossover Cosmetics

The unexpected crossover with Yu-Gi-Oh comes as the franchise was one of several that has been rumored to be added to the battle royale. Recent leaks have hinted at multiple future crossovers planned to come to Fortnite , with smash-hit Netflix movie K-Pop Demon Hunters among the biggest properties. Multiple fan-favorite games have also seen rumors about upcoming collaborations with the beloved shooter, including potential crossover with The Binding of Isaac and REPO .

Yu-Gi-Oh isn't the only popular anime to receive crossover content during Fortnite 's Chapter 6 Season 4, with another beloved series preceding it. Fortnite officially added its first collaboration with One Punch Man during the ongoing season, introducing new skins based on Saitama, Genos, and Tatsumaki. Saitama also received his own Medallion within the "Blitz Royale" game mode, granting a powerful instant-kill ability when using the Pickaxe offensively. Fans of Yu-Gi-Oh can hope that Fortnite 's new Kicks are just a precursor to even more exciting crossover content to come.

294
8.9 /10

item.title: All Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Working Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet

By using the games' Mystery Gift mechanic, Pokemon Scarlet & Violet players can get their hands on all manner of great in-game rewards. These typically range from rare or hard-to-find items to brand-new Pokemon; all of which can help players on their journey toward being the very best. However, it's important to note that Pokemon Scarlet & Violet codes don't last forever, so players should be sure to redeem them before it's too late.

The following guide contains all of the working codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , as well as step-by-step instructions on how to redeem them. We'll update it whenever new Pokemon SV codes are released by the developers, so fans of the franchise may want to consider bookmarking this page and checking it from time to time to avoid missing out on future freebies.

Updated September 20, 2025, by Tom Bowen: Between now and the end of the month, players will be able to get shiny versions of all four Treasures of Ruin Pokemon for free via the Mystery Gift option. By visiting any GameStop store before October 15, they'll also be able to get a special code that unlocks a shiny Koraidon (Violet) or Miraidon (Scarlet). To keep up to date with all of the latest Mystery Gift codes for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, Pokemon fans should bookmark this page and check back here regularly, as we're always on the lookout for new Mystery Gifts and will update the table below whenever we find one.

All Working Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes

How to Redeem Codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet

Redeeming codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet is remarkably simple, though there are a few things that players will need to keep in mind. For starters, they'll need to be connected to the internet in order to claim their rewards. They'll also need to pay attention to the redemption method. Certain rewards can be claimed without a code simply by choosing the "Get via Internet" option. Assuming there is a code though, they'll need to follow the steps below in order to redeem it:

  1. Press the X button to open up the menu and then navigate to the Poke Portal .
  2. Choose the Mystery Gift option followed by Get with Code/Password .
  3. Type in the code using the on-screen keyboard and then press the OK button .
  4. Confirm the gift by pressing the A button , then wait a few moments for it to download.

Players will not need a Nintendo Switch Online subscription to redeem codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet .
